page.title: 03ENERGY IN TILSTON
page.content: Most houses in the area use {electricity}for lighting and cooking. Farmers also use electricity for their milking machines. Houses are mainly heated by{solid fuel or oil,}although the occasional house is heated by electricity. One house in Tilston is partly heated by{solar power}panels in the roof as an experiment.{Water {energy}is used at Stretton to run the old{water mill}there. The mill is about 500 years old and was restored in the 1970's. It is now a tourist attraction (See tourism in Tilston). Many of the villagers would like to use{gas}as it is considered the most economical form of heating but unfortunately gas has not yet been piped to the area. There are one or two homes which use bottled gas for heating and cooking.
